title: Not sure if Alia can match up to Madhuri: Saroj Khan unhappy with Tamma Tamma Again | bollywood | Hindustan Times
text:
Desimartini Not sure if Alia can match up to Madhuri: Saroj Khan unhappy with Tamma Tamma Again 
Reacting to Madhuri’s involvement with the promotions of Tamma Tamma Again - the new version of the song, choreographer Saroj Khan has said she doesn’t mind not being invited and added that the new version has to be worth something for the makers to invite her. bollywood Updated: Feb 18, 2017 10:48 IST Hindustan Times Saroj Khan choreographed the original Tamma Tamma song that was picturised on Madhuri Dixit and Sanjay Dutt. 
Bollywood actors Alia Bhatt and Varun Dhawan managed to get some quick dance lessons from actor Madhuri Dixit and even praises from musician Bappi Lahiri for their latest song Tamma Tamma Again, but Saroj Khan, who choreographed the original from Thanedar is upset. 
Tamma Tamma Again is one of the songs featured in Badrinath Ki Dulhaniya, Alia and Varun’s next film. 
Watch: 
DNA report ed Saturday that Saroj Khan is unhappy with the new version of the song. She told the entertainment website, “Maybe they felt since my assistant Madhuri Dixit was there, they didn’t need me around. You have to ask them why I wasn’t invited. I don’t mind not being invited….The new version of any of my dance numbers have to be of some standard for them to invite me to watch it.” Read more Tamma Tamma Again: Alia Bhatt, Varun Dhawan sizzle in new Badrinath Ki Dulhania song 
“I haven’t seen the whole song. I’ve just seen the trailer. And I can’t comment. I worked hard because I needed to look after my children. Now my children don’t want me to work. They want me to rest at home. I am happy doing that,” she continued 
Asked about Varun and Alia’s performances in the new version, Saroj told BollywoodHungama that Varun is a good dancer and she knew that he would be able to do the dance steps well. However, Saroj said she was not sure if Alia would be able to match up to Madhuri. 
Watch the original song: 
Hindustan Times could not independently verify the report. 
The new version of Bappi Lahiri and Anuradha Paudwal’s superhit song from Thanedar (1990) is ruling the music charts and has already crossed 28 million views on YouTube in eight days. The remixed version retains the original voices. The song has been remastered by Tanishk Bagchi and also features rapper Badshah. 
Follow @htshowbiz for more
